comment: L'Hôpital's Rule. If ` I ` is an open set of the reals, ` F ` and ` G ` are real functions on ` A ` containing all of ` I ` except possibly ` B ` , which are differentiable everywhere on ` I \ { B } ` , ` F ` and ` G ` both approach 0, and the limit of ` F ` ' ` ( x ) / G ` ' ` ( x ) ` at ` B ` is ` C ` , then the limit ` F ( x ) / G ( x ) ` at ` B ` also exists and equals ` C ` . This is Metamath 100 proof #64. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Dec-2016.)
